persistence.0: State of in-flight messages is lost in case of a client shutdown or failure. Some messages may not be delivered even with QoS 1 or higher.
persistence.1: State of in-flight messages is held in persistent storage and prevents loss of messages to some degree in case of a client failure.
persistence.2: Persistence control is delegated to the application.

qos.0: Fastest method, but the delivery of a message is not guaranteed.
qos.1: Messages are guaranteed to be delivered at least once by acknowledging receipt of a message.
qos.2: Safest but slowest method. Message is guaranteed to be delivered exactly once utilizing a 4-part handshake.

errors.instance: Please enter name of MQTT instance.
errors.BrokerAddr: Please enter address of MQTT broker.
errors.KeepAliveInterval: Please enter keep alive interval greater or equal to 0 (disabled).
errors.ConnectTimeout: Please enter connection timeout greater or equal to 0 (disabled).
errors.MinReconnect: Please enter minimum number of reconnects greater or equal to 0 (disabled) and less or equal to maximum number of reconnects.
errors.MaxReconnect: Please enter maximum number of reconnects greater or equal to minimum number of reconnects.

descriptions.intermediate: General-purpose servers with a variety of clients, recommended for almost all systems. Supports Firefox 27, Android 4.4.2, Chrome 31, Edge, IE 11 on Windows 7, Java 8u31, OpenSSL 1.0.1, Opera 20, and Safari 9.
descriptions.modern: Services with clients that support TLS 1.3 and don't need backward compatibility. Supports Firefox 63, Android 10.0, Chrome 70, Edge 75, Java 11, OpenSSL 1.1.1, Opera 57, and Safari 12.1.
descriptions.old: Compatible with a number of very old clients, and should be used only as a last resort. Supports Firefox 1, Android 2.3, Chrome 1, Edge 12, IE8 on Windows XP, Java 6, OpenSSL 0.9.8, Opera 5, and Safari 1.
